data.title: Corporate responses to the Russian invasion of Ukraine
data.text:
Company Industry Country

[clarification needed] Suspended operations Remaining operations in Russia 3M Conglomerate United States Suspended all of its business operations in Russia, where it operates at least one factory.[3][4] Accenture Consulting Ireland/United States Closed business in Russia[1] Acer Computer hardware Taiwan Suspended product sales in Russia[5] Accor Hospitality France Halted all services to hotels whose owners are under U.S. or European sanctions[6] as well abandoned expansion plans in Russia[7] Accor has more than 50 hotels in Russia and continues to operate in the country in support of its 3,500 employees[8] Activision Blizzard Video game United States Suspended "new sales of and in our games"[9] Advanced Micro Devices Semiconductor company United States Chip sales to Russia[10] Adidas Clothing Germany Suspended partnership with Russian Football Union[11] Temporarily closed its stores and e-commerce operations in Russia.[12] AerCap Aircraft leasing Ireland Ceased lending to Russians[1] airBaltic Airline Latvia Cancelled all flights to and from Russia until further notice[13] Airbnb Online marketplace United States Suspended all operations in Russia and Belarus[14] Offered free, short-term housing to up to 100,000 refugees fleeing Ukraine[15] Airbus Aerospace manufacturer France Stopped providing support services to Russian Airlines[16] Continues to purchase titanium from the Russian Federation[17] Air France-KLM Airline France Stopped flights to Russia[18] Alaska Airlines Airline United States Suspended Russian partnerships[1] Alcoa Metals United States Suspended all business with Russia[19] Allianz Financial services Germany Curtailed Russian access to capital markets.[1] In June 2022, Allianz sold a 50.1% stake in its Russian operations to Interholding.[20] Alstom Rail transport manufacturer France Suspended all deliveries to Russia and any future investment in Russia.[21] Amadeus IT Group Software Spain Distribution service with Russia's Aeroflot and new planned commercial projects in Russia halted[22] Amazon Internet United States Amazon's cloud computing business, Amazon Web Services (AWS), is no longer accepting new customers based in Russia or Belarus. "Unlike some other US technology providers, Amazon and AWS have no data centres, infrastructure or offices in Russia, and we have a longstanding policy of not doing business with the Russian government".[23] Ukraine's vice prime minister, Mykhailo Fedorov, had appealed to Amazon executive chair Jeff Bezos to suspend the provision of all AWS services in Russia. AWS is not fully suspended in Russia.[24][25] Amber Grid Natural gas transmission Lithuania Abandoned all Russian natural gas imports.[26] American Airlines Airlines United States Severed all ties with Aeroflot and S7 Airlines and suspended interline agreements.[27] American Express Payment card services United States Suspended all operations in Russia and Belarus[28] AmerisourceBergen Healthcare United States Operations in Ukraine and new business initiatives in Russia are currently suspended.[29] Provision of limited logistical support of pharmaceutical products and of the existing clinical trial programs has continued[29] Amway Direct selling United States Anheuser-Busch Brewing United States Halted all shipments to Russia[1] Apple Computer hardware and software United States Halted all product sales[30]

App Store,

Apple Developer,

Apple Pay[31]

Apple Maps have been limited.[32]

Continues sales through official resellers[33] Arconic Industrials United States Pause New Contracts in Russia[34] Arconic Samara Metallurgical Plant  known as Arconic SMZ  has been in operation since 1960 and is one of Russia's largest producers of fabricated aluminum.[35] Asda Retail UK Remove products from Russia[1] ASOS Online retail UK Retail sales stopped[36] Assicurazioni Generali Insurance Italy Exit Russia completely[1] Aston Martin Luxury sports cars and grand tourers UK Retail[37] Asus Electronics Taiwan Asus stated that its shipments to Russia are at an "effective standstill". Furthermore, the company will donate $1.05 million to the Taiwanese relief agency which is in charge of humanitarian donations for Ukraine, it said.[38] AT&T Telecommunications United States Announced calls between Ukraine and anywhere else in the world would be free of charge[39] Atlas Copco Industrial equipment Sweden Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Atlassian Software Australia Pauses sales in Russia and suspends licenses state-owned or held by companies supporting the war[40] Auchan Retail France

Russia has the most Auchan supermarkets and hypermarkets outside France and is estimated to contribute one fifth of yearly group revenues, about  5bn6bn.[41] Managers in Russia deny company closing stores.[42]

Autodesk Software United States Business in Russia[43] Avid Technology Technology United States All sales and support for all customers, users and resellers in Russia and Belarus[44] Bain United States Suspend consulting for all Russian govt entities[1] Baker McKenzie Law Switzerland Suspend services for all Kremlin entities[1] Balenciaga Luxury fashion France Russian revenue streams[45] BASF Chemicals Germany BASF suspended new activities in Russia and Belarus.[1][46] BASF continues existing activities, in accordance with international sanctions.[46] Bayer Chemicals Germany CEO stated "Bayer will closely monitor and mitigate these risks to the extent possible".[47] Bayer committed to financially assisting Ukrainian employees with funds and housing. In a statement, CEP Werner Baumann deemed the invasion "a threat to our freedom and democracy, and we at Bayer condemn in the most vigorous way, this Russian attack."[48] BBC Broadcast UK BBC Studios suspended the licensing of programming to Russian customers.[49] The BBC introduced two new shortwave radio frequencies for Russia and Ukraine (15735 kHz and 5875 kHz), in response to Russian state media and censorship.[50] Bentley Luxury cars UK Halts exports to Russia[51] Binance Crypto exchange Canada Binance says will not accept cards of sanctioned Russian banks[52] CEO resisted calls to curtail operations in Russia[53] BlackRock Financial services United States Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Bloomberg United States Pull back journalists from Russia[1] BMW Luxury vehicles and motorcycles Germany Stopped car production in Russia and halts exports to Russia.[54] BNP Paribas Banking France Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] While BNP Paribas took many actions to help Ukraine, it did not pull out of Russia. Many of these were organized by local (e.g. Polish) offices.[55] Boeing Aviation, spaceflight and telecommunications United States Suspended parts and maintenance support for Russian airlines as well as its operations in Moscow[56] Suspended purchases of titanium from Russia[57] Bolt Vehicle for hire, micromobility, car-sharing, and food delivery services Estonia Ties with Russian companies[58] Bombardier Aircraft Canada Restrict new Russian business[1] BooHoo Group Online fashion retail UK Boohoo Group, which comprises Boohoo, PrettyLittleThing. Burton and Debenhams, has suspended sales in Russia[59] Booking.com Travel Netherlands Operations in Russia[60] Boston Consulting Group Consulting United States Won't take on any new work in Russia[61] "our contractual obligations, we have already started to wind down work where possible"[61] BP Oil and gas UK Abandoned stake in Russian oil giant Rosneft.[62] Bridgestone Tyres Japan "The major Japanese tire-maker said it will suspend production at its passenger car tire plant in Ulyanovsk in western Russia from Friday [March 25th] and freeze all new capital investment."[63] British American Tobacco Tobacco UK Suspended all its planned capital investment in the country.[64]

On March 11, 2022, company said it would exit Russia and cut its fiscal 2022 guidance as a result[65]

British Land Real estate UK Plans to end lease agreement with Gazprom in central London. Gazprom Marketing & Trading (GM&T) had occupied the top floors of 20 Triton Street in Regent's Park.[66] Budvar Brewing United States Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Bumble Internet United States Discontinued operations in Russia and Belarus and removed its applications form the Apple App Store and Google Play Store in Russia and Belarus.[67] Burberry Retail UK Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Cadillac Automobile manufacture United States Business to Russia[68] Canada Goose Clothing Canada Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Cannes Festival Film festival France Ban Russian Delegations[69] Canonical Software UK Halt support, professional services and partnerships with Russian enterprises[70] Continues to provide security patches to Russian customers[70] Cargill Food and agriculture United States Scaled back business operations and stopped further investments in Russia.[71] Cargill will continue operations in Russia. Carlsberg Brewer Denmark Exports, New Investments Into Russia[72] Carnival Cruise United States Along with its parent company Carnival Corporation announced all Russian tours would be cancelled, and that the company would severely limit dealings with Russian business entities.[73] Cartier Luxury goods France Operations in Russia[74] CBC Broadcast Canada Suspended all reporting and pulled all journalists.[75][76][77] Russia withdrew visas and accreditation; closed Moscow bureau.[78] CEX.io Cryptocurrency exchange Netherlands Registration of users from Russia, Belarus and Ukraine, Suspended all deposit and trading activities of clients from these regions.[79] Chanel Luxury goods France Sales in Russia[80] Chevrolet Automobile United States Vehicle exports to Russia[81] Chevron Oil and gas United States Limited business operations in Russia compared to many other large energy companies[82] Cido Grupa [lv; de] Beverages Latvia Stopped all exports to Russia and Belarus[83] Cisco Technology United States All business operations[84] While Cisco claims that it has suspended "all business operations" in Russia, reports have emerged that Cisco still does business in Russia through intermediaries.[85] Citigroup Financials United States operating Russia consumer business on 'more limited basis'[86] Cloudflare Internet United States Cloudflare has "received several calls to terminate all of Cloudflare's services inside Russia". Cloudflare has "carefully considered these requests and discussed them with government and civil society experts", but ultimately decided against terminating Russia operations.[87] CMA CGM Shipping France Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Coca-Cola Company Beverages United States Suspended business in Russia[88] Rebranding Coca-Cola, Fanta and Sprite products into Dobry Cola, Dobry Orange, Dobry Lemon-Lime. Rebranding Schweppes products to Rich. Production in the same factories as the original products.[89] Cogent Communications United States Cut all internet to Russia[1] Consumer Technology Association Trade organization United States Ban Russian exhibitors from the Consumer Electronics Show[90] Coinbase Cryptocurrency exchange United States Blocked 25,000 cryptocurrency wallet addresses related to Russia, believing them to have engaged in illicit activity.[91] Coinbase said that it would "not institute a blanket ban on all Coinbase transactions involving Russian addresses".[92] Continental AG Automotive Germany Continental "resumed tyre production for passenger cars at its Russian plant in Kaluga", in stark contrast to their competitors.[93] Coty Consumer goods United States/France Coty did not respond to an AFP request for comment[94] Coursera Online course provider United States

All content from Russian university and industry partners including courses,

Further business with Russian institutions across Coursera for Business, Coursera for Government, and Coursera for Campus,

The ability for learners in Russia to enroll in paid course experiences,

Collecting payment from any learners or institutions in Russia,[95]

Credit Suisse Financial services Switzerland Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] "Reports emerged that Credit Suisse contacted hedge fund managers and other investors asking them to "destroy and permanently erase" evidence linking the Swiss bank to loans issued to U.S.-sanctioned Russian oligarchs for luxury items including yachts and private jets." The bank just revealed it has given $1.7 billion to the Russian borrowers[96] Crunchyroll Anime United States

Jointly owned by Japanese conglomerate Sony, through its subsidiaries Sony Pictures Television and Aniplex.

Services from Wakanim and Crunchyroll EMEA are suspended from Russia.[97]

Daimler Truck Commercial vehicle manufacturer Germany Exports to Russia and production in Russia[98] Danone Food France Company would "suspend investments in Russia"[99] About 6% of Danone's sales come from Russia and Ukraine, combined. Danone has more than a dozen factories in Russia[99] and continues operations in Russia[100] Dassault Aviation Aircraft France Falcon deliveries[101] David Chipperfield Architects Architecture UK Working on their projects in Russia[102] DB Schenker Logistics Germany Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Deezer Music streaming France Subscription in Russia[103] Dell Computer hardware United States Suspended product sales in Russia[104] Deloitte Professional services network UK Separated practices in Russia and Belarus from the global network of member firms as of March 8, 2022. Deloitte Global CEO Punit Renjen said "While we know this is the right decision, it will have an impact on Deloitte's ~3,000 professionals located in Russia and Belarus. We know our colleagues in Russia and Belarus have no voice in the actions of their government. We will support all impacted colleagues during this transition and do all we can to assist them during this extremely difficult time."[105][106] Delta Air Lines Airlines United States Suspend agreement with Aeroflot[107] Dentons Law Multinational Suspend services for all Kremlin entities[1] Deutsche Bank Banking Germany On March 11, 2022, Deutsche Bank reverses course on Russia, says it is unwinding business[108] Deutsche Bank's CFO said it is not "practical" to close its Russia business[109] DHL Logistics Germany Deliveries to Russia[110] Diageo Alcoholic beverages UK Halt all shipments to Russia[1] DirecTV Communications United States Cut Kremlin backed TV networks[1] Disney Entertainment and media United States Pause all theatrical releases in Russia[111] DJI Electronics China Temporarily halted all shipments and business to both Russia and Ukraine[112] DSV A/S Halt all shipments to Russia[1] DXC Technology Technology United States Exit the Russian market[113] eBay Internet United States Suspended the delivery of orders to Russia and Ukraine from March 3[114] ECCO Fashion Denmark Ecco has stated that it will not expand business in Russia.[115] Other than not expanding business, Ecco has refused to exit the Russian market, as "[Russian employees] and their families are also going through a difficult time".[115]

Ecco loses its Royal Warrant as of April 16, 2023.

Electronic Arts Video games United States

Halts all product sales in Russia and Belarus[116]

Exclude Russia from FIFA 22 and NHL 22[117]

Eni Energy Italy Announced that it would withdraw from the Blue Stream gas pipeline linking Russia to Turkey, in which it has a 50% stake.[118] Equinor Energy Norway Exit joint ventures in Russia[1] Ericsson Networking and telecommunications Sweden Suspended deliveries to Russia[119][120] Ernst & Young Professional services network UK Separating Russia operations[105] Este Lauder Consumer products United States Initially suspended the company's business investments and initiatives in Russia. On March 7, 2022, company announced they have also decided to suspend all commercial activity in the country, closing every store they own and operate including their brand sites as well as ceasing shipments to any of their retailers in Russia.[121] Etsy E-commerce United States Cancelled all balances owed by sellers in Ukraine on its platform, totalling almost $4 million in listing fees[122] Eurovision Song contest European Countries Banned Russia from competing[123] Eutelsat Communications Eutelsat keeps operating terminals in Russia and partnerships with Russian pay-TV operators, even though they "could" turn them off.[124] About 6% of Eutelsat's 1.2B EUR FY2021 revenues come from Russia[125] As of April 8, Eutelsat keeps operating a range of telecommunication solutions in Russia, "reaching over 50% of homes".[126] Expedia Online travel United States Ceased sales to and from Russia[127] ExxonMobil Oil and gas United States Announced it was pulling out of Sakhalin-I, its only Russian investment, and further announced it would temporarily halt all further investments into the Russian Federation.[128] ExxonMobil is currently litigating against the Russian Government regarding its pullout of Sakhalin-I.[129] The company publicly announced it was complying with all sanctions against Russia[128] EPAM Systems Technology United States First announced it would stop providing services to customers in Russia,[130] then an end to all operations in Russia[131] Facebook Networking service United States Banned the Russian state media channels[132] Banned in Russia, in response to Meta allowing Ukrainian citizens to condemn Russian politicians and soldiers in its websites.[133] Farfetch eCommerce Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Fast Retailing Clothing Japan Temporarily stop sales at all stores. Brand Uniqlo[134] Fazer Food industry Finland Export to Russia[135] FedEx Transportation United States Halted all shipments to both Ukraine and Russia upon the invasion[136][137] Ferrari Manufacturer of sports cars Italy Suspended businesses with Russia[138] Ferrero Multinational food manufacturer Italy Ferrero has been present in the Russian market since 1995[139] Company yet to release a statement[140] FIFA and UEFA Sport Worldwide Suspend Russia from international football[141] and moved the UEFA Champions League final from Saint Petersburg to Paris[142] Fiskars Consumer goods Finland Decided to withdraw completely from the Russian market.[143] Ford Automotive United States Suspends business in Russia, provides aid to Ukrainians[144] Formula One Sport Worldwide Prohibition to compete under the flag of Russia[145] Games Workshop Entertainment UK Sales in Russia and Belarus suspended[146] General Electric United States Halt supply of parts to Aeroflot[1] General Motors Automotive United States Suspending its business in Russia[147] Geodis Halt all shipments to Russia[1] GitHub Software Worldwide "We are continuing to ensure free open source services are available to all, including developers in Russia"[148] GitLab Software Worldwide Suspended new business in Russia and Belarus[149] GlobalFoundries Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Globecast Networking France Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister has asked Globelcast to suspend their services in Russia. Globecast has not made a public statement regarding the conflict in Ukraine.[150] Globecast has even restricted replies to their social media posts on Twitter as many people were posting letters asking the company to suspend their services. Globus Department store Switzerland Terminated the import and selling of Russian goods Goldman Sachs Investment bank United States All operations in Russia[151] Google Internet United States Initiated a widespread blocking of Russian state media sources from advertising on their sites as well as freezing ad revenue for Russian state media YouTube channels[152]

In an effort to prevent Ukrainian armed forces and civilians from being tracked on public platforms, Google also disabled tools in Google Maps relating to live traffic.[153]

Google suspends Play Store billing and YouTube payments in Russia[154]

Some Russian bank customers barred from using Google Pay or AdSense[155]

Google Russia filed for bankruptcy, but will keep its free services (such as YouTube and Google Search) available.[156] Grammarly Software United States Service in Russia and Belarus[157] Grant Thornton UK Closing business in Russia[1] Harley Davidson Motorcycle manufacture United States Business in Russia[158] Heineken Brewing Netherlands Beer exports and investment projects in Russia[159] Henkel Chemical and consumer goods Germany Investments in Russia[160] Herbalife Nutrition products United States Suspended operations in Russia in all 62 sales centers and stopped shipping products to the country[161][162] Herms Luxury goods France Suspended its activities in Russia[163] Hewlett Packard Enterprise Computer hardware United States Halted operations and contracts in Russia and Ukraine.[164] Hitachi Manufacturing and engineering Japan Hitachi has declared it is "temporarily pausing production" at its Russia facilities as well as halting all exports.[165] Hitachi will "continue to provide products, services and support for electrical power equipment that is deemed 'essential' to citizens' daily lives".[165] 50% of Hitachi's Russian 2021 revenue came from construction machinery.[165] Hilton Worldwide Hospitality United States Pausing new Russian projects and investment in response to the war[166] closed its Moscow corporate office and donate any Hilton profits from business operations in Russia to the humanitarian relief efforts for Ukraine[167] 26 hotels in Russia that are all managed or franchised[168] H&M Clothing Sweden Temporarily suspending all of its Russian operations[169] Honda Automotive Japan Exports of cars and motorcycles to Russia[170] Hapag-Lloyd Shipping Germany Halt all shipments to Russia[1] HMM shipping South Korea Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Honeywell Conglomerate United States Suspended business in Russia and Belarus[171] HP Computer hardware United States Suspended product shipments to Russia.[172] HSBC Banking UK Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Hyatt Hospitality United States Pausing new Russian projects and investment in response to the war[173] Hyatt operates five hotels in Russia, but owns none of them[173] Hyundai Automotive South Korea Production at its St Petersburg plant in Russia due to the global components shortage and had "nothing to do with Russia's invasion of Ukraine or Western economic sanctions"[174] Hyundai operates the Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Rus factories in Sestroretsk as well as in Saint Petersburg, Russia. Company did not comment on the matter[175] IBM Technology United States All operations in Russia[176] According to Mykhailo Fedorov, adviser to Ukrainian President, IBM continues to provide consultancy services in Russia.[177] IKEA Retail Sweden Suspended its 17 stores in Russia and halted its sourcing in Russia and Belarus.[178] Ingka Group has taken the decision to pause all IKEA Retail operations in Russia.[179] The company controls 392 IKEA stores across 32 markets.[180] Inditex Retail Spain Temporarily suspended its activity in the 502 stores and on the country's online channel[181][182]

Brands: Zara Home, Bershka, Massimo Dutti, Oysho, Pull&Bear, Stradivarius, Uterqe, Lefties

Infosys Consulting India Infosys operates their Moscow office and has remained silent on the issue of Russian invasion and according to The Register have not responded to requests for comment.[183] This contrasts with its peer companies (e.g. Accenture, KPMG, PwC, DXC) who have all quit Russia. The Guardian states that "Infosys has strong historical links with Russia and Putin" and a market value of about $100bn.[184] ING Group Banking Netherlands Stopped accepting new Russian customers[185] Existing Russian customers will continue to be able to get loans[185] Intercontinental Exchange United States Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] International Paralympic Committee Disabled sporting events Germany Athletes from Russia and Belarus were banned entirely from the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing, China.[186][failed verification] International Red Cross NGO / Humanitarian organization Switzerland After Red Cross head Peter Maurer met the Russian minister of foreign affairs Sergei Lavrov,[187] it was announced that the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement will open a new office in Russia. "I would like to get your support in strengthening the logistics structure in Russia in order to improve our work in the Donbas and other parts of Ukraine under control of the Russian armed forces," Peter Maurer said. He thanked Lavrov for longstanding "positive cooperation" with Russia in various parts of the world, including in the Middle East, Afghanistan, Nagorno-Karabakh, and Ukraine, and voiced hope that this will continue.[188] Interpol International Organization UN "Interpol has no plans to exclude Russia".[189] This move was widely criticised by Western governments, who have accused Russia of using the organization to arrest Russian critics outside of Russia.[190] Instagram Social media United States Demoting posts from Russian state-media[191] Banned in Russia, in response to Meta allowing Ukrainian citizens to condemn Russian politicians and soldiers in its websites.[133] Intel Technology United States Chip sales to Russia[10] Imperial Brands Tobacco UK Halted production, sales and marketing of its products in Russia.[192] Jaguar Land Rover Automotive UK Deliveries of Russia-bound vehicles[174] Japan Tobacco Tobacco Japan Suspend 'some' operations in Russia.[134] Company announced that effective immediately, its subsidiary, JTI, will suspend all new investments and marketing activities[193]

Temporarily suspended operations at its plant in Ukraine[194]

Japan Tobacco had a 37% share of the Russian market as of December 2021 and has 4,500 employees across Russia at 70 offices and five factories.[194] JD Sports Retail UK Suspend operations in Russia[1] JetBrains Software Czechia Suspending sales and R&D activities in Russia[195] Johnson & Johnson FMCG United States Donating $5 million to support the work of the International Rescue Committee (IRC) and International Federation Red Cross and Red Crescent to provide humanitarian support for refugees in the border countries.

Providing product donations including hygiene kits, health packets and medical supplies.[196]

Will continue "providing access to our essential medical products in the countries where we operate".[196] Jooble WEB Ukraine Operation in Russia and Belarus[197] JPMorgan Chase Banking United States Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Jysk Retail chain Denmark Closed their stores in Russia[198][199] Kellogg's Food United States Shipments and investments in Russia.[200] Staple foods in Russia.[201] Kemira Chemicals Finland Discontinued deliveries to Russia and Belarus, primarily impacting pulp and paper customers in Russia.[202] Kering Luxury goods France All product sales across brands Balenciaga, Bottega Veneta, Gucci, Alexander McQueen, Yves Saint Laurent[203] Kia Automobile manufacturer South Korea Kia Group Won't Stop Exports Or Production In Russia  For Now[175] Kinross Gold Canada Suspend operations in Russia[1] Kimberly-Clark Personal care United States Halted capital spending and advertising in Russia.[204] Kimberly-Clark would continue producing and selling products in Russia, such as Huggies.[204] Kone Industrial Finland Sale of Russian subsidiary to local management; the Kone brand is not included in the deal; after sale, Kone will leave Russia[205] Korean Air Airline South Korea No flying over Russian airspace[1] KPMG Professional services network Netherlands Separating Russia operations[105] Kuehne + Nagel Logistics Switzerland Suspend all shipments to Russia[1] Kytary eCommerce Czechia Suspended all business contacts with Russian suppliers[206] KUNA Cryptocurrency exchange Ukraine All ruble pairs and closed the deposit and withdrawal of the ruble[79] Lamborghini Manufacturer of sports cars Italy Suspended businesses with Russia.[138] Latvijas Balzams Alcoholic beverages Latvia Rebranded its signature vodka to just Stoli, and changed the source of the ingredients from Russia to Slovakia.[207] Lego Toys Denmark Stopped deliveries of their products to Russia[208] Lego does not own stores in the country; 81 Russian Lego stores are owned and run by the local Inventive Retail Group, but they will not receive further shipments.[209] Inventive Retail Group renames the stores " " (Mir Kubikov) and parallel imports the stock via a third country.[210] Leroy Merlin Retail France Company operates 112 stores in Russia and does not plan to make any changes[211] Levi Strauss & Co Clothing United States Commercial operations in Russia[212] Resumed operations after rebranding to JNS brand.[213] LG Electronics Electronics South Korea Korea is seeking exemptions from the US to avoid its key export items being banned from shipping to Russia[214] Company did not say whether the company would change its business practices in Russia.[215] Life:) Communications Ukraine Linklaters UK Suspend operations in Russia[1] Live Nation Entertainment Entertainment United States Halt all operations in Russia[1] London Stock Exchange Group UK Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Lumen Technologies United States Suspend new Russian relationships[1] LVMH Luxury goods France Temporarily stop sales at all stores. Brands Mot & Chandon, Hennessy, Louis Vuitton, Givenchy, Christian Dior, Kenzo, Bulgari, Marc Jacobs, Stella McCartney, Loewe, Fendi[203] Mango Retail Spain Spanish retailer Mango closed all its 126 shops in Russia.[216] Marks & Spencer Retail UK Stopped shipments to Turkish franchisee's Russian business[217] The 48 shops (with 1,200 employees) remain open and continue to sell their existing stock.[218] Mastercard Banking United States Cards issued by Russian banks will no longer be supported by the Mastercard network regardless of where they're used - inside or outside of Russia. And, any Mastercard issued outside of the country will not work at Russian merchants or ATMs[219] Pledged $2 million toward humanitarian relief funds for Ukraine.[220] Mazda Automotive Manufacturing Japan Halt all shipments to Russia[221] Maersk Shipping Denmark Deliveries[222] McCain Foods Frozen food Canada Scrapped construction of potato plant.[223][224] Halted all deliveries to Russia.[225] McDonald's Fast food United States Owns the vast majority of the 847 McDonald's stores in Russia,[226] but the company did not offer an official position on operations in the Russian Federation.[227] McDonald's offered food assistance to Ukrainians.[228] McDonald's to close 850 restaurants[229] Reopened without McDonald's brand, business sold to Vkusno i tochka, restaurants can be bought back within 15 years.[230] McKinsey & Company Management consulting Worldwide Business with any government entity in Russia[231] MSC Shipping line Switzerland Halts all shipments to Russia[1] MSC Cruises Cruise line Switzerland Suspends travels and stops to Russia[232] Mercedes-Benz Group Vehicle manufacturer Germany Halts exports to Russia and cease manufacturing there until further notice[233] Meta Technology United States Halted advertising sales to Russian state media, such as RT[152] On March 11, 2022, Meta announced that Facebook will permit some calls for violence against Vladimir Putin and Russian soldiers[234] Metro AG Retail Germany 3,400 employees in Ukraine were making "enormous efforts" to keep its 26 stores open in the country, with each store opening decided daily by local management based on the security situation.[235] Company operates 93 stores employing around 10,000 people in Russia. Metro AG said that it isn't planning to withdraw from Russia[235] Metro spokesperson said, adding: "These people have no personal responsibility for the aggression against Ukraine." Mets Group Forestry, paper, and wood products Finland Discontinued its operations in Russia. Wood procurement in Russia for the Svir sawmill and imports to Mets Group's Finnish and Swedish mills has also been discontinued.[236] Metso Outotec Industrial machinery Finland Temporarily ceased its deliveries to Russia[237] Michelin Tire manufacturer and restaurant guide France Restaurant recommendations in Russia.[238] Michelin will transfer its tire manufacturing to a new entity under local management by the end of 2022.[239] Microsoft Technology corporation United States On 4 March 2022, Microsoft announced that they will suspend all sales and services in Russia[240]

Microsoft said they would be actively assisting the government of Ukraine, the EU, the US Federal Government, and NATO.[241][242]

The company will also provide technology and financial support for humanitarian organizations in the region, and is offering support to Ukraine-based Microsoft employees.[243]

Mitsubishi Corporate group Japan May suspend car production, sales in Russia due to sanctions[244]

Mitsubishi Electric stops Russian shipments[245]

Mitsubishi Corp. are sticking with the Sakhalin-2 project[246] Mitsui Corporate group Japan Remains involved in the Sakhalin-2 project.[246] discussing with shareholders course of action[247] Mohawk Industries Flooring manufacturer United States 4.3% of their sales come from Russia and Ukraine[248] Moncler Italy Suspend operations in Russia[1] Moody's Investors Service Investment United States Commercial operations in Russia

Moody's Investors Service (MIS),

Moody's Analytics (MA) operations[249]

Morrisons Retail UK Remove products from Russia[1] MSCI United States Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Nasdaq Financial services United States Curtail Russian access to capital markets[1] Nestl Multinational food company Switzerland Over 7,000 employees in Russia.

Suspends capital investment in Russia[250] Halted operations in Ukraine[251]

Continue to sell "essential" food products in Russia.[252]

Nestle's activities in Russia will focus on providing essential food, such as infant food and medical/hospital nutrition. Going forward, Nestl is suspending brands such as KitKat and Nesquik, among others. Nestl has already halted non-essential imports and exports into and out of Russia, stopped all advertising, and suspended all capital investment in the country. While Nestl does not expect to make a profit in the country or pay any related taxes for the foreseeable future in Russia, any profit will be donated to humanitarian relief organizations.[253]

NetApp Technology corporation United States Suspend all operations in Russia[254] Netflix Streaming service and production United States Suspended all services in Russia, as Netflix refused to offer 20 mandatory Russian state TV channels.[255][256] Nike Retail chain United States Disabled all online purchases of its products in Russia.[257] On 23 June 2022, Nike announced that it would exit Russia.[258] Nintendo Video games Japan Halt the sale of games in Russia[259] Nissan Automotive Japan Halt all shipments to Russia[1] Nokia Telecommunications, technology Finland Deliveries to Russia[260] Norsk Hydro Norway Freeze Russian investments[1] Norwegian Shipowners' Association Norway Norwegian Shipowners' Association (NSA) continues to operate and rent ships that transport Russian oil. One such example is Viking Shipping AS. Although leaders of the NSA support terminating contracts that are used to transport Russian goods, the chairman of Viking Shipping, Hans Olav Lindal, says this trade is legal.[261] Nvidia Computer hardware United States Product sales[262] oDesk Workforce management United States Okta Software United States Stop sales with customers in Russia and Belarus[263] Support for existing customers "to the extent permitted under existing sanctions and export controls"[263] OneWeb Communications UK Use of Russian rockets[264] OMV Energy Austria Divest Russian projects[1] Oracle Technology United States All operations in Russia[265] Oriflame Cosmetics Sweden Oriflame refused to leave Russia as their sales in Russia account for 16% of the company's sales.[266] Otis Worldwide Industrial United States Announced that it was scaling back its operations in Russia. it would not take new elevator and escalator orders and not make new investments in the country "for the time being."[267] Operations in Russia comprised about 2 percent of Otis' 2021 revenues, based mostly on new equipment sales.[267] Panasonic Multinational conglomerate Japan Transactions with Russia[268] Continues to transact within Russia through official resellers[269] Papa John's Restaurant chain United States March 9, 2022, announcement of suspension of all corporate operations in Russia[270] All 190 Papa John' s restaurants in Russia are licensed (franchise) and owned by Russian companies and operate normally[271] Paramount Global Entertainment United States Film distribution in Russia[272] Patreon Payments United States Patreon "decided to keep operating in Russia, allowing people to make money off the service."
